loop.title: Witch's Cauldron: The Violence Loop
loop.subtitle: Relationship stages that overlap and repeat.

diagram.label: Infinity diagram of the abuse cycle
diagram.instructions: Use Tab to move between controls and phase hotspots. Press Enter or Space to activate a phase. Use Arrow Left or Arrow Right to move between phases while the diagram is focused.
diagram.order: Phase order: Love Bombing, Devaluation, Discard, Hoovering.

loveBombing.title: Love Bombing
loveBombing.summary: Overwhelming affection and promises create a false sense of safety.

examples.0: Showering you with gifts after the very first meeting.
examples.1: Planning a shared future within a few days.
examples.2: Messaging constantly to keep your attention on them.

tips.0: Notice whether gestures match consistent behaviour over time.
tips.1: Keep seeing trusted friends and loved ones.
tips.2: Set a pace that respects your boundaries.

devaluation.title: Devaluation
devaluation.summary: Criticism and emotional withdrawal erode confidence.

examples.1: Using silent treatment when you ask for respect.
examples.2: Twisting jokes into humiliating comments in public.

tips.1: Name your feelings with a therapist or trusted ally.

discard.title: Discard
discard.summary: The abuser drops contact or blames you for the collapse.

examples.0: Ending plans suddenly without any explanation.
examples.1: Spreading rumours that you were "too needy".
examples.2: Switching affection to someone else overnight.

tips.0: Lean on friends, hotlines or local support services.
tips.1: Secure your belongings and digital accounts.
tips.2: Remind yourself that the blame is misplaced.

hoovering.title: Hoovering
hoovering.summary: Attempts to pull you back with promises or guilt.

examples.0: Sending tearful messages about changing for good.
examples.1: Appearing at your workplace without notice.
examples.2: Asking mutual friends to deliver "urgent" messages.

tips.0: Prepare a no-contact or low-contact plan with support.
tips.1: Redirect or block communication through safe channels.
tips.2: Reach out to professionals if safety is threatened.
